name: chicken pastilla
ingredients: Spices: Ginger, cinnamon, ras el hanout, turmeric (quantities unspecified)
Powdered sugar (for the sauce: quantities unspecified)
250g of blanched and crushed almonds (for a medium-sized whole pastilla)
steps: Slice the onions. Sauté them in a pot with the spices and sugar. Add the chicken thighs and brown them. Season with salt and pepper.
Add the chopped coriander and pour water to cover the poultry. Cover and simmer for 40 minutes until the meat falls off the bones.
Remove the meat. Shred the meat and set it aside. Let the sauce reduce in the pot.
When the sauce is well reduced, whisk the eggs and slowly add them to the sauce over low heat, whisking to obtain a creamy sauce. Let cool.
Toast the blanched almonds in oil or in the oven. Crush them.

Assembly: Butter the mold. Generously butter 6 sheets of brick pastry and place them so they hang over the edges of the mold. Fill with the egg mixture, shredded chicken, and crushed almonds. Fold the edges over.
Butter the remaining 4 sheets and place them on top of the filling to wrap everything. Brush with butter.
Bake at 180°C for 40 minutes until the brick pastry sheets are golden brown.
